info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 7:54PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Franklin, eastern Stephens and southwestern Oconee Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 753 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles southwest of Seneca, or 5 miles south of Westminster, moving west at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Westminster, Gumlog, Martin, Avalon, Tugaloo State Park, Fair Play, Eastanolee and Oakway. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
